website_summaries.verdict: Resembling a fancy backpack on wheels, this expandable luggage is versatile and well made.
pros: Black with blue or purple accents, this stylish 22 in
luggage is made of polyester and is water resistant
Rolls on pair of durable inline skate wheels
Features include adjustable handle, large zippered wet pocket, and break-resistant tie-down buckles
cons: Some owners have reported durability issues

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the right carry-on size: 1" too much depth for Alaska Airlines
customer_reviews.text: I had a perfectly fine travel roller bag but Alaska Airlines recently went to enforcing a new maximum carry-on bag size of 22'' x 14'' x 9'' - these dimensions include the wheels and handles. My previous bag was about 1 1/2" too long with the wheels. So I had to order this bag where they claimed the dimensions are 22 x 14 x 9. I just took the bag out of the box from Amazon and measured it. It seems that it is 22" x 14" x 10". So they are not quite right in their dimensions on Amazon. I can only hope that Alaska and other airlines do not get too picky by the extra inch of depth.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Adams

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for...
customer_reviews.text: Just fits maximum carry on bag requirements, lots of pockets, sturdy materials, good wheels. NO Spinners! - only about 15% of my travels involve rolling a bag across perfectly smooth polished terrazzo floors - the rest of the time is rough concrete, brick, stone, stairs, grass, snow, dirt.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, sturdy, reliable
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to pack & holds more than expected. Lots of pockets - exterior & interior. Handle is strong & easy up/easy down - I like that it has its own compartment that can be zipped. The wheels are sturdy & inverted under the body, so no chance of being damaged over curbs or bumps & they don't take up extra inches. It's also easy to store in the overhead bins - I'm only 5' tall & usually ask a taller passenger to help me get my bag down from the bin - well, I was able to lift it out of the bin by myself. Very happy with this bag & recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bostonian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bag / Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a really terrific bag for the price. Perfect size for a week's travel, providing you plan on checking your luggage. Bear in mind that THIS BAG IS TOO BIG TO BE USED AS A CARRY ON. The wheels are durable, and they easily roll over a wide variety of surfaces. Great size...any bigger, and it would be a bit heavy and cumbersome. I can use the large size packing cube for shirts, and I only have to fold my pants over once for them to fit. My clothes come out of the bag with a minimum of wrinkling.
customer_reviews.author: IdTater

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight yet sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag! Lightweight yet sturdy. Held everything I needed for three weeks in China and Mongolia. Went through 12 different flights as well as overland travel without a scratch. Really like the protected wheels. I didn't worry about them getting broken off. Also contains a waterproof interior pouch for wet clothes or things you wouldn't want to spill.
customer_reviews.author: maxandtip

customer_reviews.title: Travelpro's Seriously Good Bag at a Seriously Good Price!
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot for work, and my girlfriend is a flight attendant. So Travelpro has been a top brand for my consideration when looking for a new piece of luggage. We were in a Travelpro Outlet in Florida and spotted this bag. It met every single requirement I had for traveling, so I ordered this from Amazon when I got home. It's absolutely top quality and fairly priced.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A. DiossiTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for many reasons...
customer_reviews.text: I took this to Israel. It helped me keep the load under fifty pounds! It worked well. Stayed functional and strong. It fit under the bed! Beautiful color that I could easily spot on the baggage-go-round. It rolls well. The zipper around the handle keeps the handle safe and keeps it from being accidentally pulled out and damaged. It expands, too! I bought the one that was supposed to be used, but it looks brand new!
customer_reviews.author: S. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: The quality is terrible!!! the expandable zipper broke and the handle is stock can't get it off
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this luggage, because I always buy this brand, just used twice , need to expand my luggage the zipper lock or displace!!!! I will not buy it anymore I cant expand my luggage and take off the handle to pull the luggage
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: THIS is the suitcase for you!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a recent trip, and it performed like a champ. Perfect size for a 10 day vacation, and made it through the airlines without a scratch or tear. Pleased with the look - love the lemon yellow interior with waterproof pockets. Great value as well!
customer_reviews.author: Vikki Gremel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our trip to Hawaii
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these for a trip to Hawaii with my wife. Had no checked bags. These worked great for carry on only. We traveled for 10 days and three islands living out of these with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: H. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the bag.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited when I opened up the box. Nice looks and size with several nice features. Light also. I packed it today for the first time. The bag has two exterior straps, one high and one low. The low strap will not latch. It just pops open which renders the feature, which is nice to have if it works, worthless. Not sure what I'll do with it at this point but no matter what I do, I'll have to wait till I get back from this trip.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Really Want To Give It 5 Stars, but...
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I just got back from a 3 week trip to the UK and Ireland. We purchased two of the Travelpro Tpro Bold 2.0 22 Inch Expandable suitcases as they push the limits on the allowable size for international flying. The bags worked perfectly. Planes, Trains, Automobiles, and even Busses. Many times on the same day. The only reason I have to hold back one star is that my wife's suitcase has this one spot in which the zipper catches every time. Just a minor annoyance. We love the bags.
customer_reviews.author: M. Travieso

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Carryon
customer_reviews.text: Just got back from our trip and found this luggage to be quite, sturdy, light and convenient. It has enough pockets to make it easy to stay organized. It's expandable feature made it easy to pack a lot of stuff. It was an easy roll through the airport and fit nicely in overhead storage area. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great design - bad quality (made in China)
customer_reviews.text: The first one went back because the zipper didn't work (I sure love how easy Amazon handles returns). One wheel partially broke on the first trip with the replacement. This is about the largest volume suitcase available within the 62 inch airline luggage size so it could be great. The warranty is worthless as they won't send a replacement wheel and I'm not paying a lot to ship it somewhere, just don't need the hassle. Some of their products are apparently still made in the US, this is made in China so buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Stx

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Durable Travel-Tested
customer_reviews.text: Since I bought Travelpro Bold 28-inch in May 2017, it has endured an escorted tour of Ireland/Scotland and flights to/from Scandinavia without damage or noticeable wear. Of lightweight material, when packed for an international trip, suitcase usually weighs around 44#, well under the 50# airline limit. Using 'packing cubes' (highly recommend), interior space is generous; have yet to use the expandable option. A needed improvement would be on interior straps. If not for 'packing cubes', I do believe contents would shift extensively. Outer pocket offers easy access to a coat; smaller pocket for umbrella or extra bag. Prefer two-wheeled luggage which better accommodates stairs, rough surfaces, escalators, and the partially hidden wheels are less prone to damage.
customer_reviews.author: SMP

customer_reviews.title: Low budget TravelPro carry-on
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because I have a TravelPro 22" carry-on which is a really well made product, BUT the quality of this one was MUCH less than the quality of my 22". I guess this is their low-end product line. In many places where the stitching ends. they didn't bother to trim off the end and in a few places where that end was near the zipper, it would cause the zipper to jam. Also, the inside is this cheap looking yellow. If this thing cost $65 instead of $122, I MIGHT have kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter N

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight suitcase.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to take on a Danube River cruise and it held up well with the air travel, numerous trips to and from hotels and on the ship. It was remarkably lighter than my 30 year-old Atlantis suitcase of the same size. The only drawback was having a single compartment rather than two with the zipper in the middle but this seems to be the norm. We also got this because it had the two wheels in the back rather than the 4 wheels which would be almost impossible to maneuver up our gravel driveway. Overall we were very pleased with it and have ordered the 25" and 22" versions for shorter trips.
customer_reviews.author: David_A

customer_reviews.title: Sooooo durable!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a piece like this for three years and bought another for the hubby! It got us thru two weeks in Italy just perfect!!! Rolls perfectly on cobblestone walkways. Small enough to toss of trains easily, but big enough to hold what we needed for two weeks! Still looks like new after all that travel and my three year old bag does too! Ten stars for durability!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bag.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for overhead bins. It fits a lot of stuff. I no longer bring a checked bag. There is a top pocket you can put your liquids in for easy in and out at the airport. It does not have four roller wheels, so you have to carry it down the aisle. It falls over when I hook my backpack to the handle but that’s because it’s not much bigger than the backpack.
customer_reviews.author: lost child

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: 4/15/2019: Bought an identical bag for my daughter for our 8 day trip to Dubai, Oslo and Bergen. We packed for 2 weather extremes - 80/90 degree desert weather and 40/50 degree weather in Norway. Roomy with extra space to spare. Would definitely buy again. Purchased this for an 8 day trip to Reykavik and London for my husband this past week. He was able to pack all he needed which included his hiking boots. Would definitely buy another and it was delivered for free in one day! What a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: Ann S

customer_reviews.title: Very well made bag
customer_reviews.text: This luggage is very well designed and very well made. It’s sturdy, with key points reinforced. There is no need to buy luggage straps because the straps are incorporated into the luggage itself. My wife and I liked the fact that these wheels are not swivel. Having one directional wheels reduces the overall height of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: BC1 (Ret)

customer_reviews.title: Glad I picked this one
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on medium to larger sized rollaboards and landed on this bag. After having used it for several trips, I am back buying another for my daughter. We're travelling together to Europe this spring and its a perfect size to be manageable yet handle ten days worth of travel clothing with room for a few souvenirs since it expands. Its a terrific bag - smooth handle operation, rolls nicely, doesnt have the protruding wheels you get with a spinner (which I cant imagine working on cobblestone streets), and looks a bit more fun than your average suitcase (love the yellow lining).
customer_reviews.author: JB in MN

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed by the poor quality of this product.
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with this product. One international trip was all it took for the piece of luggage to start coming apart. Clasp on tie down strap that helps secure outside of bag broke after I closed it three times. Luggage material was not durable. Upon arrival at first destination it was scarred and beginning to fray. I have owned 2 other pieces of TravelPro luggage that have been great but this particular piece is not a quality product. Extremely disappointed!! I will request a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much we bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: We have this exact bag and used to for a few years and many flights. It's light and easy to pull. I like the waterproof compartment for wet bathing suits on the return trips. I like it better than the 4 wheel models because the 2 wheels are recessed and won't be damaged. The 4 wheel models seem to have the wheels exposed to a lot of abuse, and let's face it, baggage handlers don't care about our bags. I only wish we could have gotten it in purple like our older bag but it seems they discontinued that color. I can't give a better recommendation than this. We bought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: val2lay

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I got the large in Olive. I travel for work and have never seen another one, never had a problem finding it at the carousel. Saw someone with the blue one once. I can easily pack for a long trip, and can separate everything nicely. it's light and the handles are really soft and comfortable. It's holding up very well, American hasn't managed to beat it up yet.
customer_reviews.author: boogaloo baby

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 3-week trip. we were able to get by with this bag and 1 more slightly smaller bag for 2 people. We did use packing cubes--which helped get more in! The bag met our airline regulations for weight (we could have taken more!) It is durable. Went thru 6 baggage areas with no problems!
customer_reviews.author: Georgene D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect carry on
customer_reviews.text: So damn solid. Wish they had more color options and ones that looked maybe less youthful or toward a business side of things but this bag is the real deal. Best I’ve ever had and beats those much more expensive. If it had hidden backpack straps it would be perfect but still really exceptional.
customer_reviews.author: Vanished

customer_reviews.title: the suitcases were perfect for travelling on the train
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were going to be travelling to Italy, and we had heard that it was important to have a compact, maneurverable suitcase for train travel in Italy. We bought two of these suitcases, one for each of us. As we hoped, the suitcases were perfect for travelling on the train, and also fit into the back of the Citroen that we rented while in Italy. The suitcase is deep and expandable, and allowed me to pack more than a week's worth of clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Dang

customer_reviews.title: Holds Half Your Closet
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. Being TravelPro it has that great build quality that you are willing to pay more for. The wheels roll very nice, the handle isn't flimsy...pro grade zippers. The only caution is that you can easily pack 70 pounds of clothes in it so get something to weigh this ting so you dont have to pay any additional baggage fees. We also ordered the smaller one for weekend trips and we expect to get some years out of these.
customer_reviews.author: Martin L. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Unique, durable and smooth
customer_reviews.text: Well made carry on with insanely smooth wheels. Pockets are laid out well, and the cinch straps inside and out are heavy enough to be functional to compress your clothes and increase capacity. The reason I chose this bag over others is due to the look. I wanted something a little different, and this bag does that well. A little bit of individuality in a sea of black carryons. Also, spinner wheels, while nice in the airport, decrease the size of the bag to maintain airline size requirements. The pull behind maximizes space.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! * Amazing color (purple) * Sturdy construction * Rolled nice on carpet, cement and bumpy sidewalks * Fits perfectly as a carry-on in (most) US airlines * Also turned out fine after being checked on the way back home * Fit way more than I expected after using some packing cubes: Least favorite thing about the bag: The hidden back pocket wasn't really big enough to be useful for more than my keys and just took up and awkward amount of space in the main bag.
customer_reviews.author: LeahTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Different Dimensions....for the same size!
customer_reviews.text: Different Dimensions....for the same size! I would give this Travelpro a 5-star rating, except for the fact that I purchased two from Amazon - in the same order - and they arrived days apart and are of different dimensions. They are visibly a half inch apart in height and depth. We used them and they are great. It's just a bit annoying about the size.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Gottlieb

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light and so far its been bounced around ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light and so far its been bounced around airline bagge, charter plane baggage and mine pickups...doesn't seem too much the worse for wear. Nice and roomy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Gates

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great back. But be aware Lufthansa would not allow as a carry on
customer_reviews.author: C M

customer_reviews.title: I Hate that this this 22" carry on will not fit ...
customer_reviews.text: I Hate that this this 22" carry on will not fit in a 22" box at the airport. But the product is close to perfect. More than what I expected. I fly standby, sometimes with only an hour between flights. If I was made to check this at the gate, I would have to cancel the flight. I hope they re-design this soon so that it meets 22 x 14 x 9 dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Dale in Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I'll update after I travel, but on first impression, this suitcase is great. No flaws / defects on mine upon delivery. Great size, lightweight, tons of handles, straps to keep everything secured. Zippers and handle glide smoothly, and it seems durable. I bought a backpack from the same collection, and it's amazing too. The color scheme is unique, which will make finding it on the luggage carousel easy.
customer_reviews.author: AmKam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag. I'm picky, like decent quality, and this thing is great. I wish it was available in more colors, but that gripe isn't worth knocking a star off. There is plenty of room, the wheels are high-quality and roll well, and the handle is easy to extend and retract. Best of all, it survives well through the gorilla-like handling that airlines put luggage through. This is definitely not a carry-on, but I like it so much I'm considering buying their carry-on for shorter trips.
customer_reviews.author: nzpete

customer_reviews.title: Strap would not buckle when expanded
customer_reviews.text: This was a great bag except for one major defect. It has straps with buckles that fasten over the zipper closure --- but the bottom strap is not long enough to allow the buckle to connect when the suitcase is expanded, which is exactly when you are most likely to need the straps. I had thought it was just this one bag but it looks like others have had the same problem. Not sure if all the bags are like this or there was just a manufacturing defect affecting some of the bags.
customer_reviews.author: S. D.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made and within the 62 linear inches of most TSA travel restrictions
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well made and within the 62 linear inch limitation for check in bags of most TSA travel restrictions. It looks and feels of quality and durable material and is spacious enough for a 10 day trip. This is a good looking rolling soft shell suitcase with a handle long enough to piggy back another bag on top of it. I am using High Sierra Wheeled Under Seat Suitcase Carry-on Wheeled Travel Bag which turns for sideways placement for it's pass through strap to do just that. Haven't traveled with it yet, but my travel companion who has her own has and says it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Quest

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid choice
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a year and it still looks new (but I've probably only flown 15-20 times since purchase). I like the pocket arrangement, the extra security of the rubberized/plastic exterior buckles in case a zipper breaks in transit, the handle, and the fact that it's blue & black so easy to recognize from the sea of black bags. It seems very well made. I've owned a dozen carry-ons in the past, and this is one of my top favorites. While it lacks the swivel roller function, I think that's a good trade-off for lighter weight and more space inside for packing.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Inside Brightness
customer_reviews.text: This Travelpro is just the right size for a women who packs way too much for a long weekend (and I always check my luggage with the airlines). What I particularly like is the bright inside lining. I can see everything easily. I guess I wear too much black, because a dark lining makes items difficult to distinguish from each other. I took a chance buying this from Amazon, because I thought I needed to see a piece of luggage in person. However, I knew the size, saw the colors, and took a chance. I am so glad I did. Thanks again to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: MemphisBelle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome carry on for 2 weeks of rail travel.
customer_reviews.text: Used for 2 weeks in France. Worked great as carry on and love the multiple handles on sides. That makes getting into overhead bin less straining. The rolling bags are more useful for getting from train station to hotel. Probably put 4-5 miles on this trip. Only damage was abrasions along the bottom from cobble stone sidewalks and curbs.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stonerock

customer_reviews.title: Well made, looks good
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, but already love it. Made well, has more room than my old bag and plenty of pockets and compartments. We will see how it stands up to the airline gorillas! Only thing that I think I don’t like are the inline wheels. I push my bag beside me most of the time, but maybe not a big deal, just different than what I’m used to.
customer_reviews.author: Daddyo

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, solid, dependable, lightweight travel bag!
customer_reviews.text: Love the bag and the colours appealed to me. My previous experience with travelpro made me look at their website first before looking at another brand. As an airline pilot I need a solid, sturdy bag that can take a beating and one that lasts a long time. when the bag is not fully filled and the straps are tightened I am not sure if the bag is sturdy enough. Also, the rubber clips are not going to last long I think but so far so good, I just got the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Marn1Alg

customer_reviews.title: A good travelling companion
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I do not like the "spinner" type luggage that is so popular. So far I have used it to make about 3 round trips to Asia (Houston-Dallas-Narita), and the luggage looks as good as new. Some reviewers have criticized the rubber straps, me, I like them, it gives an extra level of security that the luggage zipper (which is sturdy) won't pop open if roughly handled. I originally bought just the mid-sized version, and have since purchased the other two sizes. I purchased this luggage on my own.
customer_reviews.author: Subman

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than advertised. Just heavy
customer_reviews.text: It's a small suitcase, the weight we measured was 7.9lb, which was more than 7.2lb in the item description, but is too much regardless. There are serviceable 5-sh lb suitcases of the same size/functionality out there
customer_reviews.author: Kate Middlesex

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but tough.
customer_reviews.text: So it has been on six flights now as checked baggage (four of those with very short connections) and it still looks brand new. I thought it might be a little flimsy when I got it, and was worried about the straps getting caught, but nope, not at all. It is easy to spot on the carousel and holds a great deal. On the way home I'm always short on space but not now -- the sections on the lid are great. Super happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Noodles

customer_reviews.title: Great compact suitcase
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my 12 year old to use on our 2 week trip to Europe. It held a lot, was very easy to use and held up in all types of "offroad" situations. I thought it lightweight and the interior wet pocket was useful when we had to move and pack a damp bathingsuit. The only downside from her perspective was that the gold interior was ugly with the purple and black exterior (have to agree with that), and I thought that the rounded top made it a little harder to pack flat items like dresses, and balance things on top as you roll it, because it's asymmetrical.
customer_reviews.author: Lafayette mom

customer_reviews.title: Best carry on that I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best carry on that I have ever used. Very sturdy and very maneuverable. It survived a hellish cross-country trip and fared much better than I did.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of luggage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because the 10 year old cheap stuff is falling apart. Though I haven't gone on any trips yet, this thing is very well made and I expect it to last quite a while. Roomy, well laid out as far as luggage is concerned. Heavy duty zippers and hardware. Even the wheels look like they'll survive walks on cobblestone and they're protected a bit on the sides. Compared to other pieces, this looks like one might actually be able to take bits of it apart to fix IF any thing happens to break on it. Looking forward to using it on upcoming trips and if I remember I'll post an update.
customer_reviews.author: Ex Army

customer_reviews.title: I liked the Light weight but sturdy aspect
customer_reviews.text: I liked the Light weight but sturdy aspect. The color combo helped identify it in baggage and the adjustable handle for pushing around was easy. The wheels are only on one side but maneuver just a well without banging into my legs.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and easily handled 10 days worth of clothing
customer_reviews.text: Suitcase is lightweight and moves smoothly. Well made, sturdy and easily handled 10 days worth of clothing. Did not have any issues with tipping even though the backpack was slipped on the handle. Color is quickly spotted on the luggage carousel. .
customer_reviews.author: Linda Hoefflin

customer_reviews.title: it is a travel pro
customer_reviews.text: great bag delivered in super fast time and works great. this is an excellent bag for one to two week-long business trips where you are going overseas and have little logistics support so no laundry is available due to hoping for city to city. just did 10 days going through Dubi and Sri Lanka and back and this held it all from jungle kit to business suits and had plenty of room to pack 1.5 Kilos of tea and other goodies for the return trip.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hamby

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer flaw?
customer_reviews.text: Everything is superb or better than expected, except the main front large zippered section has the inside section sewed in upside down making it almost impossible to use properly. Manufacturer flaw? However, not worth returning the bag. Large zippers, nice smooth rolling wheels and the ease of handling this with numerous handles make it a solid carry on bag overall.
customer_reviews.author: David Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Love this luggage!
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I was looking for and I love it. Other reviewers complained about the expandable side straps, but they don't bother me, especially when I see the overaall quality of the luggage and the thought that was put into the design. I bought another to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Durable and great on uneven surfaces!
customer_reviews.text: Just got from my first trip with this luggage. I already had the carry on that I absolutely love. This item is exactly what I wanted and expected. Easy roll. Durable wheels. Takes curbs and sidewalks like a champ!!! I also enjoy that the purple stands out at baggage claim making it so much easier to identify from a distance.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and roomy but...
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice suitcase, well constructed with plenty of rooms and pockets but I my only complaint is that the rubberized plastic buckles on it are cheaply made. You wonder not if but how long they will last before they break. Once broken they will just flop around, serving no purpose until you decide to cut them off, which defeats the purpose of you purchasing this particular suitcase in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Terrible Tommy B

customer_reviews.title: handle is sturdy.. rolls well
customer_reviews.text: Well made.. handle is sturdy.. rolls well .. very stable . Packed heavy items on bottom and lighter to the top and the case never felt like it would tip when it was sitting. Just took it on a multi stop tour with lots of loading and unloading and it shows no wear. Expect to have years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Baker

customer_reviews.title: An Expandable Bag that is rugged
customer_reviews.text: Great expandable bag. I found it to hold all I wanted to take with me for an international trip and the expandable part allowed me to take back those few extra souvenirs. An overall good bag. One note is that the sides are all soft. I have an old Travelpro and the sides are hard. That is the only difference that I noticed.but it didn't seem to make any difference.
customer_reviews.author: John N.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for long trips.
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a 16 day tour of the British Isles two months ago, and it was perfect. The outside pockets made it easy to stay organized, and there is overall a lot of room in this suitcase. It is lightweight for its size, and held up well for this trip. It does not maneuver as well as a spinner suitcase, but has larger, sturdier wheels that felt more secure on cobblestone streets. I liked it so much that I have ordered the same suitcase in 22 inch size.
customer_reviews.author: Ann in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for toting around.
customer_reviews.text: I like the sturdy zippers and the front handle for snatching the bag up while it's lying on its back. There are sensible pockets to segregate my gear. I hate the side straps with the flimsy rubber buckles and the difficult-to-adjust straps. I'm knifing those off soon. Good bag for rough travel like I frequently encounter.
customer_reviews.author: Morania

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Too small. I measured it compared to my other carry-on, and it's a full 3 inches shorter. It's also much more shallow. There is room for expansion, but then I'm worried about it fitting into the overhead bin. I'm also confused by the straps on the side. Seems superfluous. It does seem well made. Just wish it were a more standard carry-on size.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Leonard

customer_reviews.title: very well designed suitcase!  Nice in-line wheels, easy to roll over cobblestones.
customer_reviews.text: this bag is GREAT! The handle stows away in a zippered compartment. the wheels are tough and roll easily over cobblestones. There is a handle on nearly every side which makes it great for handling. and there are straps to contain the load in case the zipper fails. I love this bag!
customer_reviews.author: C. Coombs

customer_reviews.title: Great Piece of Luggage
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a max size suitcase we could check with the new airline dimensions. My last TravelPro lasted me 25 years. We absolutely love it. Huge inside and very durable. Also easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and great storage compartments
customer_reviews.text: Have had this bag for a year now and it’s held up well. Love all the compartments and the padded front section for my iPad or other electronics. Also found the plastic compartment useful for wet items. It expands quite a bit bit of overpacked won’t fit in the some plane’s overhead bin. Primarily if too much stuff is put in the outer compartments. The synch straps help compress the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Websissy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, weight and durability for overseas travel
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size, weight and durability for overseas travel. We can pack for multi-month trips. I like the extra exterior straps for extra support.
customer_reviews.author: T. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased With the Travel Carry-On
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the quality and size of this carry-on. I bought a smaller one last week which led me to also buy this next-larger size for a set. They are rugged/durable, and they are very nice looking as well. The inside of each is spacious and there is a, enclosed pocket in it to pack things that might leak. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Man

customer_reviews.title: Very nice luggage
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy, roomy enough for a week trip even without expanding. The outside straps are kind of in the way and I thought about cutting them off but I may like having them if I take this on a flight. Rolls easily and the handle and wheels seem sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: rcburto

customer_reviews.title: Best I've tried so far!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is so great, so well built and roomy, that I have decided to ditch all my other travel bags and go with Travel Pro exclusively.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. G

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great travel bag. It easily fit a bunch of items I needed for a weekend trip. It was easy to get around, and was light which made it easy to lift when going up stairs. And it is colorful so it is easy to find in a group of other bags. Highly recommended for a weekend travel bag.
customer_reviews.author: W. Levenson

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Packed for a 10 day trip with no issues. Love the weight and quality. lots of pockets. We bought 2 of these and will be buying more for future travels.
customer_reviews.author: C Murphy

customer_reviews.title: The redundant straps are nice features for that extra insurance as we all know ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. The redundant straps are nice features for that extra insurance as we all know our bags aren't necessarily handled with care at the airport.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rosinski

customer_reviews.title: very nice bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag, quality materials and construction. As long as you don't try and pack your entire house in this bag it will fit in every overhead. Rolls great, lightweight. Only drawback is the price, you can find cheaper in many places, but I'm going to doubt they will outlast this bag.
customer_reviews.author: B. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great carry on travel bag
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on a couple flights now and have a pretty good feel for it. it has plenty of storage space and tie down straps to help compress clothing. So far seems very sturdy. Fits in overhead storage bin without any issues as long as you don't expand the storage area by unzipping the extra zipper section.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. I had a previous version
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. I had a previous version. This one has 2 seperate zipper enclosures on the inside of the lid. This really limits bags capacity. Also outside straps get in the way and do not easily close. I'm a fan of travel pro bags but this was not the best of their models.
customer_reviews.author: W. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: It’s sturdy and roomy
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my new carryon!! We have done some international and cross US travel and so been through airports a lot. It stands by itself, easy to spot on the carousel, loads in overhead bin easily and is roomy! I should have replaced my old one years ago. (It’s a fav of airline pilots and staff too) Soooo glad to find it!
customer_reviews.author: fit4life11

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: Light, seems sturdy, fits enough cloths for two weeks with room to spare. Like that it has handles all over it
customer_reviews.author: Thuringer

customer_reviews.title: A great rolling suitcase!
customer_reviews.text: Just took this on its first trip. It was everything it's cracked up to be. Easy to handle, doesn't fall over when fully loaded and expandable for the trip home.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Fielding

customer_reviews.title: EASY to spot on the Luggage conveyor!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this choice in luggage. Hubby and I went on a 4 day trip to Vegas, and it was large enough to carry clothes for both of us, yet small enough to be able to check with Southwest Airlines and not be over weight on it. It was also VERY EASY to spot coming down the luggage conveyor as the purple and black color scheme made it stand out. It really seems to be very good quality luggage, and I'm happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice expandable design.
customer_reviews.text: Made it to Germany and back and still looks new. Is very sturdy and compact; but feels a little heavier than expected. Roll clothes and it can handle a lot. Worked for a two week trip. Nicely designed.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Lee o'Hare

customer_reviews.title: It holds a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Actually I have not used this small one yet but purchased it after using the 26" 4 wheeler. It survived a long trip well and the carry handles all around the bag made it easier to handle as it got heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Tough and light weight
customer_reviews.text: After 10 airline flights in a couple of cross country trips in a car these bags show very little wear. They are well-designed, durable and easy to move around. I have seen some luggage with more clever interiors. But these are quite sufficient and a lot less costly than the more clever ones I have encountered.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking...you can find better.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is light weight and it does seem sturdy. But in spite of all the glowing reviews, there are some issues. The only apparent use for the two straps is to annoy the user. The suitcase is terminally front heavy and when packed, it constantly falls forward. The main zipper tends catch in the lower corner, as the curve is slightly sharp. Keep looking...you can find better.
customer_reviews.author: JPC

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent carry on bag. Love the compartment for wet items. Also love the rounded shape so it squeezes into most overhead bins! Attractive styling and a very stable and sturdy rolling mechanism. Would order again!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: I Would Buy It Again, And Again, And Again!
customer_reviews.text: We have owned TravelPro Bold luggage for years and love it for its durability and sturdiness. Love the purple color of this one! Wish the inside wasn't yellow, but you can't have it all. Dark gray or black interior would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first trip
customer_reviews.text: Strap broke on trip I returned from yesterday. It was the first use. Extremely unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: As good as gets!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the bigger one for years and it still looks new. Bought this one for my wife who travels non stop for work, she loves it. She said it's by far the best one she has ever had. She's been traveling regularly for 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Swen

customer_reviews.title: Great and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Great size for United carry-on, looks good, and functions well. My kids loved rolling it through the airport, finally some free labor out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Good carry on bag
customer_reviews.text: Pretty basic bag but does the job for a carry on. I checked the bag one time and it stood up well. Rollers are nice and sturdy and bag sticks out when trying to locate. I would buy again
customer_reviews.author: lloyd

customer_reviews.title: The right size for travel
customer_reviews.text: I just completed a 21 day vacation in Spain, Portugal and France. This bag held all that I needed and more. It was easy to maneuver in airports. So far the bag has shown it can take the normal wear and tear experienced at airports and on cruise ships. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: WES

customer_reviews.title: A great bag for many uses.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. I do a lot of travel photography and a camera backpack is too heavy. Rolling camera bags are too expensive. I put a smaller camera backpack in this bag and I have the best of all worlds, a rolling camera bag, small backpack if needed and a small bag for clothing for short trips (when not using it for the camera).
customer_reviews.author: Ed Berlien

customer_reviews.title: Rugged
customer_reviews.text: Rugged, beautifully designed bag. I especially like the zippered pocket for the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Allan R.

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the sealed zipper compartment for wet clothes or toiletries
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to use on longer trips and is exactly what I needed. Seems to be constructed well and has a large capacity. First trip was a five day trip to Central America and had more than enough room. Rollers worked well on all terrain and the handle was just right. I really liked the sealed zipper compartment for wet clothes or toiletries. It may be a little too big, for average trip but I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mgilliland

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Versatility In a Medium Size Bag
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 3-week New Zealand trip. Medium size bag with deep primary well that held lots of clothes and supplies. Expanded easily to the point of crazy. Liked the heavy clips on the sides to keep it rigid. Front pockets where well designed and great for papers and maps. The zippers are heavy duty. Become my go-to bag for all trips. Easy to use in multiple situations and uneven terrain.
customer_reviews.author: LakeMead Jim

customer_reviews.title: Where is my bag?
customer_reviews.text: Bought my wife this series a while back. Loved it so much got one for myself. The two tone color makes the bag Unique zoo find at the airport. The added straps help keep the zippers in tact. Water proof pouch is great for Toiletries or wet clothes .
customer_reviews.author: Yah I am That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great as a Checked or Carry-On Bag
customer_reviews.text: I have used this suitcase for several international trips and it works well overall. The maneuverability could be a bit better but it holds a surprising amount of clothes and items and holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations so far
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, holds all my stuff well, matches my Travel Pro Backpack perfectly .... I've had it 3 weeks and air traveled 2 of the 3 weeks .... seems well made and good quality.... I air travel 40+ weeks a year so I will put it to the test!
customer_reviews.author: KingsBattle

customer_reviews.title: It made it through a 1 week trip to Disney.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit concerned with the 28” luggage. It seems as if the bigger they get the flimsier it gets. I own the carry-on size as well (which feel so much sturdier). To my surprise luggage traveled to and from Disney World vía JetBlue with no mishaps.
customer_reviews.author: ZeroPerfect

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, large
customer_reviews.text: Well designed. I like the straps that back up the zipper. The back is soft and may do as another suggested and add some stiff cardboard (zipper accessable). My daughter is a flight attendant and was required to use Travelpro Crew line bags. I carry two four piece kayak paddles in this one (wrapped in clothes).
customer_reviews.author: BayKayaking

customer_reviews.title: awesome product. this is the 3rd TravelPro bag I ...
customer_reviews.text: awesome product. this is the 3rd TravelPro bag I have now, one bigger, and one carryon. They are very well built, and very light weight. Since owning and using TravelPro, I will probably not go to any other company in the future. I expect these to last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

product_meta.title: Travelpro Bold-Softside Expandable Rollaboard Upright Luggage, Purple/Black, Carry-On 22-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:Carry-On 22-Inch| Color:Purple/BlackThe 22" Expandable Rollaboard is part of the Travelpro BOLD Collection. Stay neat and organized as you travel the globe, with the BOLD by Travelpro 22" Expandable Rollaboard. Made with rugged high-density polyester fabric and a water repellent coating. Retractable, telescoping handle. Top and side padded handles for easy lifting. Front zip pocket for quick-access items such as phones, cords, and snacks. Padded pocket allows quick access to your tablet without opening the main compartment. Six exterior slip pockets. One exterior credit card slot. Hidden back pocket ideal for quick access to change, keys, electronic cables, phone and more. Interior opens book-style to reveal a mesh zip compartment and wet pocket. Three interior slip pockets. Interior adjustable compression straps with Duraflex buckles. Ball-bearing wheels creates a smooth ride on any surface.
feature_bullets: Expandable Rollaboard carry on suitcase with easy to access exterior padded tablet sleeve is made of rugged, high density polyester fabric with water repellent coating for greater stain resistance
Strong, telescoping Aircraft grade aluminum handle stops at 38 inches and 42 inches for users of different heights. High performance ball bearing wheels deliver a smooth roll

Protective reinforced wheel housings, skid guards and molded corner guards protect high wear points. Compression straps for additional security have rubberized buckles for comfort. Interior mesh pocket is built into the lid
Backed by Travelpro built for a lifetime limited warranty with the trusted companion promise
Case Dimensions: 21x14x9 inches, Oveall Dimensions: 22.5x14.5x9 inches, Weight: 7.2 pounds

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars172 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
